intro: Semecarpus balansae, commonly known as the Balansae sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive fruiting structures. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the genus Semecarpus. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. The bark and fruits of Semecarpus balansae have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
